column4: does the latest edition of ubuntu server install with wireless adapters?
depends on the chip

past versions of ubuntu seemed to have installed with it. but this latest one looks like it hasnt.  i'm resintalling again, just to ensure i did it right.. but incase it doesnt install again, is there a bundle for wireless drivers i can apt-get?
maybe: linux-backports-modules-wireless-lucid-generic or if you are installing server      linux-backports-modules-wireless-lucid-server
obviously change the release name if necessary
thank you
gnome-mplayer
all players can play all formats as there is a central repository of codecs in the OS
if one can play a format, so can the others. I recommend you install both as they will pull in a lot of codecs
i had some issues playing iso videos and .vobs
also add the medibuntu repo and install w32codecs as well as ubuntu-restricted-extras
thanks. will do!
vlc and mplayer can play them as file, just use the file menu
how do you mean?
from terminal, i have a program ffmpeg. but it's an older machine (has versionitis) and i cant see which version of mmpeg is loading from command.
you can see what binary is ran when you run a command using: which <commandhere>        e.g.    which nano
that did it. thanks
you can write a script (ftp can be scripted too)
or mount the ftp then rsync as ac7ss says
have the ftp permanently mounted at boot using fstab
looks good to me
